bitfield.description: Receive data (for 8-, 12-, or 16-bit data) or Low part of receive data (for 20-, 24- or 32-bit data)
High part of receive data (for 20-, 24- or 32-bit data)
Transmit data (for 8-, 12-, or 16-bit data) or Low part of receive data (for 20-, 24- or 32-bit data)
High part of transmit data (for 20-, 24- or 32-bit data)
Receive sign-extension and justification mode bits.

bitenum.description: Right justify the data and zero fill the MSBs.
Right justify the data and sign-extend the data into the MSBs.
Left justify the data and zero fill the LSBs.
Reserved (do not use)
Clock stop mode, without clock delay
Clock stop mode, with half-cycle clock delay
DX delay enabler off
DX delay enabler on
The McBSP sends a receive interrupt (RINT) request to the CPU when the RRDY bit changes from 0 to 1, indicating that receive data is ready to be read
In the multichannel selection mode, the McBSP sends a RINT request to the CPU after every 16-channel block is received in a frame.
The McBSP sends a RINT request to the CPU when each receive frame-sync pulse is detected.
The McBSP sends a RINT request to the CPU when the RSYNCERR bit is set, indicating a receive frame-sync error.
No error
Receive frame-sync error
No receiver-full condition
Receiver-full condition: RSR[1,2] and RBR[1,2] are full with new data, but the previous data in DRR[1,2] has not been read.
Receiver not ready
Receiver ready: New data can be read from DRR[1,2].
If you read a 0, the receiver is in its reset state. If you write a 0, you reset the receiver.
If you read a 1, the receiver is enabled. If you write a 1, you enable the receiver by taking it out of its reset state.
The McBSP transmit and receive clocks are affected as determined by the SOFT bit.
Free run.
Hard stop.
Soft stop.
If you read a 0, the frame-sync logic is in its reset state. If you write a 0, you reset the frame-sync logic.
If you read a 1, the frame-sync logic is enabled. If you write a 1, you enable the frame-sync logic by taking it out of its reset state.
If you read a 0, the sample rate generator is in its reset state. If you write a 0, you reset the sample rate generator.
If you read a 1, the sample rate generator is enabled. If you write a 1, you enable the sample rate generator by taking it out of its reset state.

The McBSP sends a transmit interrupt (XINT) request to the CPU when the XRDY bit changes from 0 to 1, indicating that transmitter is ready to accept new data (the content of DXR[1,2] has been copied to XSR[1,2])
In the multichannel selection mode, the McBSP sends an XINT request to the CPU after every 16-channel block is transmitted in a frame.
The McBSP sends an XINT request to the CPU when each transmit frame-sync pulse is detected.
The McBSP sends an XINT request to the CPU when the XSYNCERR bit is set, indicating a transmit frame-sync error.
No error
Transmit frame-sync error
Transmitter-empty condition
No transmitter-empty condition
Transmitter not ready
Transmitter ready: DXR[1,2] is ready to accept new data.
If you read a 0, the transmitter is in its reset state. If you write a 0, you reset the transmitter.
If you read a 1, the transmitter is enabled. If you write a 1, you enable the transmitter by taking it out of its reset state.

bitfield.description: Receive frame length 1 bits (1 to 128 words).

bitenum.description: 8 bits
12 bits
16 bits
20 bits
24 bits
32 bits
Single-phase frame
Dual-phase frame

bitfield.description: Receive frame length 2 bits (1 to 128 words).

bitenum.description: 8 bits
12 bits
16 bits
20 bits
24 bits
32 bits
No companding, any size data, MSB received first
No companding, 8-bit data, LSB received first
u-law companding, 8-bit data, MSB received first
A-law companding, 8-bit data, MSB received first
Frame-sync detect.
Frame-sync ignore.
0-bit data delay
1-bit data delay
2-bit data delay
Reserved (do not use)
8 bits
12 bits
16 bits
20 bits
24 bits
32 bits
Single-phase frame
Dual-phase frame
8 bits
12 bits
16 bits
20 bits
24 bits
32 bits
No companding, any size data, MSB transmitted first
No companding, 8-bit data, LSB transmitted first
u-law companding, 8-bit data, MSB transmitted first
A-law companding, 8-bit data, MSB transmitted first
Frame-sync detect.
Frame-sync ignore.
0-bit data delay
1-bit data delay
2-bit data delay
Reserved (do not use)

bitfield.description: Frame-sync pulse width bits for FSG.
Frame-sync pulse width bits for FSG.

bitenum.description: No clock synchronization
Clock synchronization
A rising edge on the CLKS pin
A falling edge on the CLKS pin

bitfield.description: Sample rate generator input clock mode bit.

bitenum.description: The input clock for the sample rate generator is taken from the CLKS pin or from the CLKR pin, depending on the value of the SCLKME bit of PCR
The input clock for the sample rate generator is taken from the McBSP internal input clock or from the CLKX pin, depending on the value of the SCLKME bit of PCR

bitfield.description: Sample rate generator transmit frame-sync mode bit.

bitenum.description: If FSXM = 1, the McBSP generates a transmit frame-sync pulse when the content of DXR[1,2] is copied to XSR[1,2].
If FSXM = 1, the transmitter uses frame-sync pulses generated by the sample rate generator.
2-partition mode
8-partition mode
Block 1: channels 16 through 31
Block 3: channels 48 through 63
Block 5: channels 80 through 95
Block 7: channels 112 through 127
Block 0: channels 0 through 15
Block 2: channels 32 through 47
Block 4: channels 64 through 79
Block 6: channels 96 through 111
Block 0: channels 0 through 15
Block 1: channels 16 through 31
Block 2: channels 32 through 47
Block 3: channels 48 through 63
Block 4: channels 64 through 79
Block 5: channels 80 through 95
Block 6: channels 96 through 111
Block 7: channels 112 through 127
All 128 channels are enabled.
Multichannel selection mode.
2-partition mode.
8-partition mode.
Block 1: channels 16 through 31
Block 3: channels 48 through 63
Block 5: channels 80 through 95
Block 7: channels 112 through 127
Block 0: channels 0 through 15
Block 2: channels 32 through 47
Block 4: channels 64 through 79
Block 6: channels 96 through 111
Block 0: channels 0 through 15
Block 1: channels 16 through 31
Block 2: channels 32 through 47
Block 3: channels 48 through 63
Block 4: channels 64 through 79
Block 5: channels 80 through 95
Block 6: channels 96 through 111
Block 7: channels 112 through 127
Transmit multichannel selection is off.
All channels are disabled unless they are selected in the appropriate transmit channel enable registers (XCERs).
All channels are enabled, but they are masked unless they are selected in the appropriate transmit channel enable registers (XCERs).
This mode is used for symmetric transmission and reception.

bitfield.description: This bit is the idle enable bit.

bitenum.description: The McBSP remains active when the PERIPH domain is idled.
If the PERIPH domain is idle (PERIS = 1 in the idle status register), the McBSP is stopped in a low-power state.
The CLKX, FSX, DX, and CLKS pins are serial port pins.
If XRST = 0, the CLKX, FSX, and DX pins are GPIO pins.
The CLKR, FSR, DR, and CLKS pins are serial port pins.
If RRST = 0, the CLKR, FSR, and DR pins are GPIO pins.
Transmit frame synchronization is supplied by an external source via the FSX pin.
Transmit frame synchronization is supplied by the McBSP, as determined by the FSGM bit of SRGR2.
Receive frame synchronization is supplied by an external source via the FSR pin.
Receive frame synchronization is supplied by the sample rate generator.
The transmitter gets its clock signal from an external source via the CLKX pin.
Internal CLKX is driven by the sample rate generator of the McBSP.
The McBSP is a slave in the SPI protocol.
The McBSP is a master in the SPI protocol.
The CLKR pin is an input pin that supplies the internal receive clock (CLKR).
Internal CLKR is driven by the sample rate generator of the McBSP.

bitfield.description: Sample rate generator input clock mode bit.

bitenum.description: The input clock for the sample rate generator is taken from the CLKS pin or from the McBSP internal input clock, depending on the value of the CLKSM bit of SRGR2
The input clock for the sample rate generator is taken from the CLKR pin or from the CLKX pin, depending on the value of the CLKSM bit of SRGR2
The signal on the CLKS pin is low.
The signal on the CLKS pin is high.
Drive the signal on the DX pin low.
Drive the signal on the DX pin high.
The signal on DR pin is low.
The signal on DR pin is high.
Transmit frame-sync pulses are active high.
Transmit frame-sync pulses are active low.
Receive frame-sync pulses are active high.
Receive frame-sync pulses are active low.
Transmit data is driven on the rising edge of CLKX.
Transmit data is driven on the falling edge of CLKX.
When the CLKR pin is configured as an input, the external CLKR is not inverted before being used internally and the receive data is sampled on the falling edge of CLKR.
When the CLKR pin is configured as an input, the external CLKR is inverted before being used internally and the receive data is sampled on the rising edge of CLKR.
